name: service
description: Services are provided by organizations to a range of different groups. Details on where each service is delivered are contained in the services_at_location table.

id.name: id
id.description: Each service must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization that provides this service.

program_id.name: program_id
program_id.description: The identifier of the program this service is delivered under.

name.name: name
name.description: The official or public name of the service.

alternate_name.name: alternate_name
alternate_name.description: Alternative or commonly used name for a service.

status.name: status
status.description: The current status of the service.

interpretation_services.name: interpretation_services
interpretation_services.description: A description of any interpretation services available for accessing this service.

application_process.name: application_process
application_process.description: The steps needed to access the service.

fees_description.name: fees_description
fees_description.description: Details of any charges for service users to access this service.

accreditations.name: accreditations
accreditations.description: Details of any accreditations. Accreditation is the formal evaluation of an organization or program against best practice standards set by an accrediting organization.

eligibility_description.name: eligibility_description
eligibility_description.description: A description of the type of person for whom this service is intended.

minimum_age.name: minimum_age
minimum_age.description: The minimum age required to meet this eligibility requirement.

maximum_age.name: maximum_age
maximum_age.description: The maximum age required to meet this eligibility requirement.

assured_date.name: assured_date
assured_date.description: The date that the information about the service was last checked

assurer_email.name: assurer_email
assurer_email.description: The contact e-mail address for the person or organization which last assured the service.

alert.name: alert
alert.description: Notice of any short term alerts concerning the service.

items.name: schedule
items.description: The schedule table contains details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid.

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

until.name: until
until.description: iCal - The date of the last occurence of the recurring event.

count.name: count
count.description: iCal - The number of times that the event occurs. Use this instead of ‘until’, if appropriate.

wkst.name: wkst
wkst.description: iCal - The day on which the week starts, eg MO.

freq.name: freq
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Frequency use one of WEEKLY or MONTHLY.

interval.name: interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Interval 2 for Frequency WEEKLY gives Fortnightly

byday.name: byday
byday.description: iCal - Comma seperated days of the week. E.g. SU,MO,TU,WE,TH,FR,SA. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

byweekno.name: byweekno
byweekno.description: iCal - Comma seperated numeric weeks of the year if freq is WEEKLY. Can be negative to represent weeks before the end of the year; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last week in a year.

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month if frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

byyearday.name: byyearday
byyearday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month if frequency is YEARLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the year; e.g. -1 is the last day in a year.

description.name: description
description.description: Human readable description of the availability of the service.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the scheule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.description:
How to attend this service.

Application Profile Notes: Expected to reference a taxonomy ratehr than an enumeration in future versions

notes.name: notes
notes.description: Human readable notes on the schedule

items.name: attribute
items.description: The services attributes table creates a link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

id.name: id
id.description: Each service_attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.description: The identifier of the service to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.description: What the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or the sevice intended audience. Populate from an enumeration (an open codelist)

value.name: value
value.description: The value (if any) of an attribute

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term table contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.description: Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset

code.name: code
code.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term

name.name: name
name.description: The taxonomy term itself.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this should be left blank.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.description: Taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the taxonomy from which terms are sourced.

items.description: The metadata table contains a record of the changes that have been made to the data in order to maintain provenance information.

resource_type.name: resource_type
resource_type.description: The type of entity being referenced

last_action_date.description: The date when data was changed.

last_action_type.name: last_action_type
last_action_type.description: The kind of change made to the data; eg create, update, delete

replacement_value.name: replacement_value
replacement_value.description: The new value of a field that has been updated

updated_by.name: updated_by
updated_by.description: The name of the person who updated a value

language.description: An ISO 639-1, or ISO 639-2 [language code](available at http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php) to represent the language of the term. The three-letter codes from ISO 639-2 provide greater accuracy when describing variants of languages, which may be relevant to particular communities.

items.name: service_at_location
items.description: The services at location table creates a link between a service and a specific location.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service at a given location.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this service operates.

description.name: description
description.description: Any additional information that should be displayed to users about the service at this specific location.

items.name: phone
items.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number

type.name: type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.description: A description providing extra information about the phone service (e.g. any special arrangements for accessing, or details of availability at particular times.

items.name: language
items.description: The language table contains details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which phone is availible in.

name.name: name
name.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

code.name: code
code.description: ISO 639 -1/3 code

note.name: note
note.description: Description of what applies to the language e.g. ocasional translation service

location.name: location
location.description: The location tables provides details of the locations where organizations operate. Locations may be virtual, and one organization may have many locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each location must have a unique identifier

url.name: url
url.description: The URL of a virtual location

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: Each location entry should be linked to a single organization. This is the organization that is responsible for maintaining information about this location. The identifier of the organization should be given here. Details of the services the organization delivers at this location should be provided in the services_at_location table.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the location

alternate_name.name: alternate_name
alternate_name.description: An alternative name for the location

transportation.name: transportation
transportation.description: A description of the access to public or private transportation to and from the location.

latitude.name: latitude
latitude.description: Y coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.name: longitude
longitude.description: X coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

external_identifier.name: external_identifier
external_identifier.description: Third party identfier of a location e.g. UK UPRN or what3words

external_identifier_type.name: external_identifier_type
external_identifier_type.description: Enumeration including UPRN, what3words and others

items.name: phone
items.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

items.name: schedule
items.description: The schedule table contains details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid.

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

until.name: until
until.description: iCal - The date of the last occurence of the recurring event.

count.name: count
count.description: iCal - The number of times that the event occurs. Use this instead of ‘until’, if appropriate.

wkst.name: wkst
wkst.description: iCal - The day on which the week starts, eg MO.

freq.name: freq
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Frequency use one of WEEKLY or MONTHLY.

interval.name: interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Interval 2 for Frequency WEEKLY gives Fortnightly

byday.name: byday
byday.description: iCal - Comma seperated days of the week. E.g. SU,MO,TU,WE,TH,FR,SA. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

byweekno.name: byweekno
byweekno.description: iCal - Comma seperated numeric weeks of the year if freq is WEEKLY. Can be negative to represent weeks before the end of the year; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last week in a year.

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month if frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

byyearday.name: byyearday
byyearday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month if frequency is YEARLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the year; e.g. -1 is the last day in a year.

description.name: description
description.description: Human readable description of the availability of the service.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the scheule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.description:
How to attend this service.

Application Profile Notes: Expected to reference a taxonomy ratehr than an enumeration in future versions

notes.name: notes
notes.description: Human readable notes on the schedule

id.name: id
id.description: Each postal address must have a unique identifier

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the postal address.

attention.name: attention
attention.description: The person or entity whose attention should be sought at the location (Often included as ‘care of’ component of an address.)

address_1.name: address_1
address_1.description: The first line(s) of the address, including office, building number and street.

address_2.name: address_2
address_2.description: A second (additional) line of address information.

city.name: city
city.description: The city in which the address is located.

region.name: region
region.description: The region in which the address is located (optional).

state_province.name: state_province
state_province.description: The state or province in which the address is located.

postal_code.name: postal_code
postal_code.description: The postal code for the address.

country.name: country
country.description: The country in which the address is located. This should be given as an ISO 3361-1 country code (two letter abbreviation)

link_type.name: link_type

taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term table contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

name.name: name
name.description: The taxonomy term itself.

parent_id.name: parent_id

items.name: contact
items.description: The contact table contains details of the named contacts for services and organizations. Note that in the HSDS data package format, if an individual is the contact for multiple services, their details may be duplicated multiple times in this table, each time with a new identifier, and with the rows containing different service ids.

id.name: id
id.description: Each contact must have a unique identifier

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the person

title.name: title
title.description: The job title of the person

department.name: department
department.description: The department that the person is part of

email.name: email
email.description: The email address of the person

items.name: phone
items.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number

type.name: type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.description: A description providing extra information about the phone service (e.g. any special arrangements for accessing, or details of availability at particular times.

items.name: language
items.description: The language table contains details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which phone is availible in.

name.name: name
name.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

code.name: code
code.description: ISO 639 -1/3 code

note.name: note
note.description: Description of what applies to the language e.g. ocasional translation service

items.name: schedule
items.description: The schedule table contains details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid.

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

until.name: until
until.description: iCal - The date of the last occurence of the recurring event.

count.name: count
count.description: iCal - The number of times that the event occurs. Use this instead of ‘until’, if appropriate.

wkst.name: wkst
wkst.description: iCal - The day on which the week starts, eg MO.

freq.name: freq
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Frequency use one of WEEKLY or MONTHLY.

interval.name: interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Interval 2 for Frequency WEEKLY gives Fortnightly

byday.name: byday
byday.description: iCal - Comma seperated days of the week. E.g. SU,MO,TU,WE,TH,FR,SA. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

byweekno.name: byweekno
byweekno.description: iCal - Comma seperated numeric weeks of the year if freq is WEEKLY. Can be negative to represent weeks before the end of the year; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last week in a year.

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month if frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

byyearday.name: byyearday
byyearday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month if frequency is YEARLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the year; e.g. -1 is the last day in a year.

description.name: description
description.description: Human readable description of the availability of the service.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the scheule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.description:
How to attend this service.

Application Profile Notes: Expected to reference a taxonomy ratehr than an enumeration in future versions

notes.name: notes
notes.description: Human readable notes on the schedule

contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number

type.name: type

description.name: description
description.description: A description providing extra information about the phone service (e.g. any special arrangements for accessing, or details of availability at particular times.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which phone is availible in.

items.name: contact
items.description: The contact table contains details of the named contacts for services and organizations. Note that in the HSDS data package format, if an individual is the contact for multiple services, their details may be duplicated multiple times in this table, each time with a new identifier, and with the rows containing different service ids.

id.name: id
id.description: Each contact must have a unique identifier

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the person

title.name: title
title.description: The job title of the person

department.name: department
department.description: The department that the person is part of

email.name: email
email.description: The email address of the person

items.name: phone
items.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number

type.name: type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.description: A description providing extra information about the phone service (e.g. any special arrangements for accessing, or details of availability at particular times.

items.name: language
items.description: The language table contains details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which phone is availible in.

name.name: name
name.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

code.name: code
code.description: ISO 639 -1/3 code

note.name: note
note.description: Description of what applies to the language e.g. ocasional translation service

items.name: attribute
items.description: The services attributes table creates a link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

id.name: id
id.description: Each service_attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.description: The identifier of the service to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.description: What the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or the sevice intended audience. Populate from an enumeration (an open codelist)

value.name: value
value.description: The value (if any) of an attribute

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term table contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.description: Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset

code.description: The term identfier as used in the taxonomy. This and the taxonomy_id combined define the term

name.name: name
name.description: The taxonomy term itself.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this should be left blank.

taxonomy.description: Taxonomies from which taxonomy terms are taken

items.name: location
items.description: The location tables provides details of the locations where organizations operate. Locations may be virtual, and one organization may have many locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each location must have a unique identifier

url.name: url
url.description: The URL of a virtual location

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: Each location entry should be linked to a single organization. This is the organization that is responsible for maintaining information about this location. The identifier of the organization should be given here. Details of the services the organization delivers at this location should be provided in the services_at_location table.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the location

alternate_name.name: alternate_name
alternate_name.description: An alternative name for the location

transportation.name: transportation
transportation.description: A description of the access to public or private transportation to and from the location.

latitude.name: latitude
latitude.description: Y coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.name: longitude
longitude.description: X coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

external_identifier.name: external_identifier
external_identifier.description: Third party identfier of a location e.g. UK UPRN or what3words

external_identifier_type.name: external_identifier_type
external_identifier_type.description: Enumeration including UPRN, what3words and others

items.name: contact
items.description: The contact table contains details of the named contacts for services and organizations. Note that in the HSDS data package format, if an individual is the contact for multiple services, their details may be duplicated multiple times in this table, each time with a new identifier, and with the rows containing different service ids.

id.name: id
id.description: Each contact must have a unique identifier

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the person

title.name: title
title.description: The job title of the person

department.name: department
department.description: The department that the person is part of

email.name: email
email.description: The email address of the person

items.name: phone
items.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number

type.name: type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.description: A description providing extra information about the phone service (e.g. any special arrangements for accessing, or details of availability at particular times.

items.name: language
items.description: The language table contains details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which phone is availible in.

name.name: name
name.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

code.name: code
code.description: ISO 639 -1/3 code

note.name: note
note.description: Description of what applies to the language e.g. ocasional translation service

items.name: schedule
items.description: The schedule table contains details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid.

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: The timezone that all dates are expressed as, expressed as a UTC offset. Dates are assumed to be UTC otherwise.

until.name: until
until.description: iCal - The date of the last occurence of the recurring event.

count.name: count
count.description: iCal - The number of times that the event occurs. Use this instead of ‘until’, if appropriate.

wkst.name: wkst
wkst.description: iCal - The day on which the week starts, eg MO.

freq.name: freq
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Frequency use one of WEEKLY or MONTHLY.

interval.name: interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Interval 2 for Frequency WEEKLY gives Fortnightly

byday.name: byday
byday.description: iCal - Comma seperated days of the week. E.g. SU,MO,TU,WE,TH,FR,SA. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

byweekno.name: byweekno
byweekno.description: iCal - Comma seperated numeric weeks of the year if freq is WEEKLY. Can be negative to represent weeks before the end of the year; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last week in a year.

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month if frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

byyearday.name: byyearday
byyearday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month if frequency is YEARLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the year; e.g. -1 is the last day in a year.

description.name: description
description.description: Human readable description of the availability of the service.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the scheule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.description:
How to attend this service.

Application Profile Notes: Expected to reference a taxonomy ratehr than an enumeration in future versions

notes.name: notes
notes.description: Human readable notes on the schedule

items.name: phone
items.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number

type.name: type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.description: A description providing extra information about the phone service (e.g. any special arrangements for accessing, or details of availability at particular times.

items.name: language
items.description: The language table contains details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which phone is availible in.

name.name: name
name.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

code.name: code
code.description: ISO 639 -1/3 code

note.name: note
note.description: Description of what applies to the language e.g. ocasional translation service

items.name: contact
items.description: The contact table contains details of the named contacts for services and organizations. Note that in the HSDS data package format, if an individual is the contact for multiple services, their details may be duplicated multiple times in this table, each time with a new identifier, and with the rows containing different service ids.

id.name: id
id.description: Each contact must have a unique identifier

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the person

title.name: title
title.description: The job title of the person

department.name: department
department.description: The department that the person is part of

email.name: email
email.description: The email address of the person

items.name: phone
items.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

id.name: id
id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is the phone number

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

extension.name: extension
extension.description: The extension of the phone number

type.name: type
type.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

description.name: description
description.description: A description providing extra information about the phone service (e.g. any special arrangements for accessing, or details of availability at particular times.

items.name: language
items.description: The language table contains details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which phone is availible in.

name.name: name
name.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

code.name: code
code.description: ISO 639 -1/3 code

note.name: note
note.description: Description of what applies to the language e.g. ocasional translation service

items.name: cost_option
items.description: The cost option table contains the costs of a service at certain points in time. This is an LGA Extension table. This table provides a structured version of the text information contained in the 'fees' field of the 'service' table.

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.description: The identifier of the services for which the entry describes the cost

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.description: When this price is valid from

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.description: When this price is valid to

option.name: option
option.description:
Conditions associated with the cost option.

Application Profile Notes: e.g.For the over 60's
1st session

amount.name: amount
amount.description: The cost of the option, expresssed as an amount in a currency (expected to be GBP by Open Referral UK).

amount_description.name: amount_description
amount_description.description: Specific details qualifying the cost amount, e.g. 'per session'

id.description: Each service area must have a unique identifier

description.description: A more detailed description of this service area. Used to provide any additional information that cannot be communicated using the structured area and geometry fields.

extent_type.name: extent_type
